title.rendered: IPL 2024: DC All-Rounder Mitchell Marsh Ruled Out Of Remaining Games With Hamstring Injury.

content.rendered:
Delhi Capitals suffered a major setback on Monday as all-rounder Mitchell Marsh was ruled out of the Indian Premier League (IPL 2024) season due to injury.

Mitchell Marsh returned to Australia last week after suffering a torn ligament in his right leg. The Delhi team management brought back Mitchell Marsh, who was set to captain Australia for the T20 World Cup in June, to hold talks with him.

His last appearance came against Kolkata Knight Riders on April 3. But he was absent for the matches against Mumbai Indians and Lucknow Super Giants.

All the best for DC

Marsh’s highest score this season was 23 against Rajasthan Royals, a match in which DC won by 12 runs. However, he got revenge in their 106-run win against KKR. Across the series, Marsh has been in exceptional form for the Kangaroos. Culminating in receiving the Allan Border Award, given to Australia’s outstanding cricketer of the year.

Since January 2023, the 32-year-old has amassed 1,954 international runs in 38 appearances at an average of 50.10. Including three centuries, and has taken 10 wickets.

Read Also: Noise Level At Ekana During LSG vs CSK Reach MASSIVE Heights When MS Dhoni Comes Out To Bat
